Do you think media organizations, as a result of this, the Dan Rather story, are becoming more cautious about using anonymous sources?
Oh, I think that caution has been going on for a couple of years.
I think The Washington Post looked at its procedures and policies, I think, about a year ago.
The New York Times just came out with a report from its Credibility Committee, and everyone's doing everything they can to restrict the use of anonymous sources as much as possible.

One thing that we teach and that everyone is pushing for now is to get documents after sources have told you something, so you don't have to rely on them, that you can really get a document state of mind; that is when someone says something, look for the document that either backs them up or contradicts them.
In some of these stories, there's no way to do that, but as often as possible, that's what we're pushing people to do, get them on the record and get the documents.
